This process will also include working closely with Customer Success and our Services teams to identify at-risk clients and better understand the client lifecycle.     Leadership: Product Management is a difficult role, with immense responsibility, competing demands, and the constant pressure of making difficult decisions. The Sr. Director will provide steady leadership, mentoring, and support for the product team with the goal of ensuring that morale and productivity remain high. description: Job description  Team Management: The Sr. Director, Product Management will lead a team of 4 individuals and will be responsible for managing individual and team performance, creating a culture of continuous improvement, and ensuring that the team consistently aligns to corporate objectives. This individual will handle performance management, training, coaching, onboarding, and other day-to-day activities, and will be heavily involved in budgeting and strategic planning.        Roadmap & Backlog: The product team is responsible for maintaining roadmaps for each product, translating those roadmap items into epics and stories, and ensuring that those stories are properly groomed and accepted by our engineering teams. The Sr. Director will ensure that both the roadmap and backlog are updated frequently and provide a clear vision for the direction of a grouping of products that aligns to broader corporate strategy, technology roadmap, and product vision. They’ll provide frequent updates and reporting on roadmap contents and progress, as well as the decision-making process that goes into defining the Roadmap.   Process & Project Coordination: The Sr. Director, Product Management will work closely with other teams, including UX/UI Design, Engineering, Tech Ops, Support, and Marketing to ensure that all projects function smoothly. Where necessary, the Manager will work to create and implement policies, procedures, and processes in order to improve our workflow and output. This role also includes internal collaboration with other leaders inside of the Product team, including VPs, Product Directors, Managers, and Product Managers.   Customer Feedback: The Sr. Director will construct and oversee a formal customer-feedback process designed to survey clients, collect relevant data, and use that as part of the design process. This process will also include working closely with Customer Success and our Services teams to identify at-risk clients and better understand the client lifecycle.     Leadership: Product Management is a difficult role, with immense responsibility, competing demands, and the constant pressure of making difficult decisions. The Sr. Director will provide steady leadership, mentoring, and support for the product team with the goal of ensuring that morale and productivity remain high. This role should also take special care that individual product managers and possibly product directors are adequately supported and mentored. Leadership includes bringing product management best practices to the team.
